tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool run classical molecular dynamics simulations in NAMD using an NPT ensemble. User can run the simulation in small time intervals. The coordinates, velocities and the extended system files can be use to restart the simulations. Harmonic restraints can be used. NAMD collective variable module is used to give RMSD harmonic restraints.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
- xplor.psf input file. - .pdb input file. - PME grid specs generated from the minimizer tool. - Temperature - coordinates , velocities and extended system file if you restarting the simulation. - backbone , side chains and substrates reference structures if you want to give RMSD harmonic restraints. - Force constants of the harmonic restraints - extra topology and parameter file (if necessary). - The simulation time in pico seconds (default is set to 1000 or 1 ns). - The number of processors to run the simulation (default is set to 4).
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
- coordinate file of the final system. - velocities file of the final system. - velocities file of the final system - DCD trajectory output. - NAMD output file.
